thread.title: Mexico orphanage fuels Toledo
thread.title_full: Mexico orphanage fuels Toledo - San Antonio Express-News

author: John Whisler
title: Mexico orphanage fuels Toledo
text:
Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News Image 1 of / 1 1 Esteban Toledo guides a shot off the fairway on 15 during the first round of the San Antonio Championship at the TPC San Antonio, AT&T Canyons Course on October 16, 2015. Esteban Toledo guides a shot off the fairway on 15 during the first round of the San Antonio Championship at the TPC San Antonio, AT&T Canyons Course on October 16, 2015. Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News Mexico orphanage fuels Toledo 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Esteban Toledo grew up in a ramshackle hut with dirt floors and no plumbing, the youngest of 11 children.
Three weeks ago, the 53-year-old Champions Tour golfer hoisted a trophy and a check for $300,000 after winning the Nature Valley First Tee Open at Pebble Beach, California.
“It’s amazing how far I’ve come,” he said. “But sometimes it’s not about me or you. It’s about helping others in this world.”
Helping others long has been a focus of Toledo and recently reached an apex for the Mexicali, Mexico, native with construction of an orphanage that bears his name in his hometown on the U.S.-Mexico border.
The Esteban Toledo Family Foundation Home is never far from the golfer’s mind, and that was the case during Friday’s opening round of the San Antonio Championship.
Toledo shot a 1-under par 71 on the AT&T Canyons Course, four strokes behind the leader, Wes Short Jr. of Austin.
For more, visit ExpressNews.com
